title: The Executive Branch
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 566 words, Level N (Grade 2), Lexile 740L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     U and Z1
description: To help ensure a balance of power in the United States, the U.S. Constitution founded three branches of government. The executive branch is led by the president, and the president's cabinet carries out the laws written by Congress. Sometimes the other branches work with the president. Sometimes they work against the president.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
